trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_000<tab>You're that adventurer everyone's talking about, aren't you? The one working with the Allied forces? If there's anything you need, don't hesitate to ask.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_010<tab>You can call me M'zalikko. If I'm not mistaken you've already met my older sister, Naago.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_013<tab>Our father, M'rahz Nunh, is leader of the M tribe. He's likely one of the few males you'll ever see among us.

TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_014<tab>They stay only to challenge him in a bid to claim his title of nunh. Those who fail remain as tia, or leave and attempt to create tribes of their own.

TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_015<tab>Under normal circumstances, there can be only one nunh in our tribe, you see. Although there was a time when our lands were vast, and two nunhs led our people.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_020<tab>Thanks to you and yours driving the Garleans out of Castellum Velodyna, we can finally start getting things back to the way they were.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_021<tab>In the darker days of their occupation, it was M'rahz Nunh who inspired us, who gave us the strength to live.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_022<tab>We owe him our lives, and we'll gladly give them to defend him and our home.
TEXT_REGGYR3THEPEERINGSTONES_00395_MZALIKKO_000_023<tab>I doubt there has ever been a nunh before him so loved by his people.
